strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]

to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: And then I tried to cheer up and began thinking about improving my English level.
sentences.chinese: 然後，強打精神，開始思考提高自己的英文水準。

sentences.english: Her spirit supported her, but the agony of her mind was severe.
sentences.chinese: 她強打精神，但內心卻十分痛苦。

sentences.english: Hearing that his mother had died, John gathered himself together and said he wanted a drink.
sentences.chinese: 聽說母親去世，約翰強打精神，並說想喝上一杯。

definition: to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known

to stake all on one throw

lit. to cross five passes and slay six generals (idiom)/fig. to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success)
